etymologies: Middle English: from Old French tresorie (see treasure)

definitions: the funds or revenue of a government, corporation, or institution

examples.text: the country's pledge not to spend more than it has in its treasury

shortDefinitions: funds or revenue of state or society

definitions: (in some countries) the government department responsible for budgeting for and controlling public expenditure, management of the national debt, and the overall management of the economy

examples.text: he is chief secretary to the Treasury

shortDefinitions: (in some countries) government department responsible for budgeting for and controlling public expenditure, management of national debt

definitions: a place or building where treasure is stored

examples.text: Henry VII had kept the peace and filled his treasury

shortDefinitions: place or building where treasure is stored

definitions: a store or collection of valuable or delightful things

examples.text: the old town is a treasury of ancient monuments

shortDefinitions: store or collection of valuable or delightful things
